intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to select an item from a menu.

item.title: Create a Test Case
item.description:
Create a Test Case called Select item from menu.
Open the Test Case Editor for this Test Case.

item.title: Reference a Test Case to select an item from a menu
item.description:
From the unbound modules, browse to the category:
Actions (basic) > Select > Menu Bar

subitem.label: Select the Test Case "ub_mbr_selectEntry_byTextpath". Drag it into the Test Case Editor.

item.title: Enter the parameter details for the Test Case
item.description:
This Test Case has two parameters, which you can see in the properties view.
In the Textpath parameter field, enter:
Edit.*/Add category.*
In the Operator parameter field, enter:
matches
Using matches as an operator means that you do not have to enter the whole parameter value. You can use regular expressions.

item.title: Save the Test Case editor
item.description: You now have a Test Case which will select "Edit > Add category" from the menu in your application.

item.title: Execute the test
item.description: Try this Test Case out on the DVD Tool. You will need to create a Test Suite, and add this Test Case to it. You may also need to select the AUT you want to use in the Properties View for the Test Suite Editor.
